com.picocontainer.parameters

Class ComponentParameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.picocontainer.parameters.AbstractParameter
      • com.picocontainer.parameters.BasicComponentParameter
        • com.picocontainer.parameters.ComponentParameter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parameter, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JSR330ComponentParameter

    public class ComponentParameter
extends BasicComponentParameter
    A ComponentParameter should be used to pass in a particular component as argument to a different component's constructor. This is particularly useful in cases where several components of the same type have been registered, but with a different key. Passing a ComponentParameter as a parameter when registering a component will give PicoContainer a hint about what other component to use in the constructor. Collecting parameter types are supported for Array,Collectionand Map.
    Author:
    Jon Tirsén, Aslak Hellesøy, Jörg Schaible, Thomas Heller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComponentParameter

        public ComponentParameter(Object key)
        Expect a parameter matching a component of a specific key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the desired addComponent

      • ComponentParameter

        public ComponentParameter()
        Expect any scalar parameter of the appropriate type or an Array.

      • ComponentParameter

        public ComponentParameter(boolean emptyCollection)
        Expect any scalar parameter of the appropriate type or an Array. Resolve the parameter even if no compnoent is of the array's component type.
        Parameters:
        emptyCollection - true allows an Array to be empty

      • ComponentParameter

        public ComponentParameter(com.googlecode.jtype.Generic<?> componentValueType,
                  boolean emptyCollection)
        Expect any scalar parameter of the appropriate type or the collecting type Array,Collectionor Map. The components in the collection will be of the specified type.
        Parameters:
        componentValueType - the component's type (ignored for an Array)
        emptyCollection - true allows the collection to be empty

      • ComponentParameter

        public ComponentParameter(Class<?> keyType,
                  com.googlecode.jtype.Generic<?> componentValueType,
                  boolean emptyCollection)
        Expect any scalar parameter of the appropriate type or the collecting type Array,Collectionor Map. The components in the collection will be of the specified type and their adapter's key must have a particular type.
        Parameters:
        keyType - the component adapter's key type
        componentValueType - the component's type (ignored for an Array)
        emptyCollection - true allows the collection to be empty

      • ComponentParameter

        public ComponentParameter(Parameter mapDefiningParameter)
        Use this constructor if you are using CollectionComponentParameter
        Parameters:
        collectionParameter - the collection component parameter used for finding matching components

                         ComponentAdapter<?> forAdapter,
                         ComponentAdapter<?> injecteeAdapter,
                         Type expectedType,
                         NameBinding expectedNameBinding,
                         boolean useNames,
                         Annotation binding)
        Description copied from class: BasicComponentParameter
        Check whether the given Parameter can be satisfied by the container.
        Specified by:
        resolve in interface Parameter
        Overrides:
        resolve in class BasicComponentParameter
        Parameters:
        container - the container from which dependencies are resolved.
        forAdapter - the ComponentAdapter that is asking for the instance
        injecteeAdapter - the adapter to be injected into (null for N/A)
        expectedType - the required type
        expectedNameBinding - Expected parameter name
        useNames - should use parameter names for disambiguation
        Returns:
        true if the Parameter can be verified.
        See Also:
        Parameter#isResolvable(PicoContainer, ComponentAdapter, Class, NameBinding ,boolean, Annotation)
